meanings.definition: The quality of retaining color without fading or running.
meanings.sent1: The colorfastness of this fabric ensures that it will not fade easily.
meanings.sent2: It is important to check the colorfastness of a garment before washing it.
meanings.sent3: The colorfastness of the paint on the wall made it impossible to cover up a mistake.
meanings.sent4: Her loyalty to her team showed a colorfastness that never wavered.
meanings.sent5: The colorfastness of the dye was so strong that even after years, the color remained vibrant.

meanings.definition: The ability of a material to resist color change or transfer.
meanings.sent1: The colorfastness of the carpet prevented any color from rubbing off onto shoes.
meanings.sent2: When buying new curtains, it's essential to consider their colorfastness.
meanings.sent3: The colorfastness of the marker was so good that even after a spill, it didn't leave a mark.
meanings.sent4: His steadfastness in his beliefs was a true example of colorfastness.
meanings.sent5: The colorfastness of the fabric was so impressive that even after multiple washes, it looked brand new.
